page.title: 19PETROCKSTOWE CROPS & LABOUR
page.content: The 14 farms surveyed totalling{2361 {acres}are farmed by{26 people}full time (mostly family) plus 13 part-time & additional casual help with harvest etc. An average farm (168 acres) is farmed by 1.8 people (90 acres per man). 6 farms grow{grain,}with{barley predominant (360 acres) & equal quan- tities of wheat & oats. Some 300 acres produce hay & 350 acres silage, cut 2 or 3 times annually. Only 50 acres grow root fodder & most farmers only devote 1 acre to (human) edible crops. As a sheep-farming community there are 19 working dogs - only 2 farms don't have one. Until 1958 virtually all the land belonged to the Clinton Estate, when it was sold to meet double death duties. Now only 1/12th of the area, in some 6 plantations, remains part of the Estate, as{productive woodland, mainly coniferous.
